accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mainly correspondence regarding the acquisition of portraits and paintings for the Orton Memorial Library of Geology, Ohio State University,Columbus; biographical sketches; sketches; financial material; and clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REELS 1814-1815: 634 letters regarding the acquisition of portrait paintings of state geologists and landscape paintings with rock formations for the library; 5 brief biographical sketches of artists and writers; clippings; 3 sketches; bills; and receipts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 3161: Correspondence, 1922-1926, regarding the acquisition by the library of one painting by Thomas Moran and two paintings by Albert Bierstadt.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 1814-1815 & 3161 available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals in: Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Geologist; Columbus, Ohio. Orton was a long-time chairman of the Department of Geology, Ohio State University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated 1978-1979 by Frank M. Ludden, Chairman of the Art History Department at the University of Ohio, Columbus, Ohio.
